text: hey guys welcome to my first ever
Mystery Box challenge this week I've
teamed up with the guys over at Mazetti
and they sent me three ingredients that
I have to work into a recipe when I open
my box I was a little bit stumped I
ended up with some extra virgin olive
oil I got some red hot chili pepper
everything paste and they got some
maraschino cherries as stands now the
cherries are a no-brainer but the other
two I wasn't quite sure what I was going
to do with them so I put it out to you
guys on the my cupcake addiction
Instagram and I got so many amazing
suggestions you guys are so creative so
today I'm going to be making kind of a
bit of a mash up of my favorite
suggestions and we're gonna be making
some molten chocolate chili cherry lava
cakes let's get started so some of these
ingredients are specific to Mazetti so
I'm gonna link to them as at a website
down below but I've got my maraschino
cherries with stems my Red Hot Chili
everything paste and my extra virgin
olive oil there's a few components to
today's recipe so we're going to make
some frosting using some butter some
powdered sugar and a little bit of
either cherry essence or vanilla essence
we're gonna make a chopped chili ganache
using some powdered chili dark chocolate
and some whipping cream as well as of
course our Red Hot Chili everything pays
for your base cupcakes I've got some
butter sugar and an egg some cocoa and
some flour as well as some water now I
always add some olive oil to my mixture
it just really helps lock in moisture
for decoration share I've got a star
piping tip and a small circle cutter
you're also going to need a strainer or
sieve I've got a ziploc bag a disposable
piping bag a plain napkin and of course
the cupcake tray with some cupcake
liners all of your measurements and
quantities can be found in the
description box below this video before
we start cooking you just want to start
getting rid of some of the juices on
your decoration cherries so pull out
your six best stemmed maraschino
cherries and just pop them onto that
absorbent paper towel now I've had some
requests from you guys for some small
batch recipes so this particular recipe
makes six cupcakes but of course you can
double it or triple it for however many
you need one of the things I love about
this recipe is the simplicity there's no
creaming there's no folding you just pop
all of your ingredients straight into a
mixer it doesn't matter if you're using
a paddle or a whisk here you dump them
all in start your mixer on a low speed
and then turn it up until the mixture
lightens it's almost foolproof in goes
our magic ingredient it was actually my
dad that told me years ago to always put
some olive oil in with my cupcakes
because it really does help lock in that
moisture and it keeps them moister for
longer I think some of the best tips in
the world are those that we passed down
through families so if you guys have got
any hints and tips for quirky or weird
ingredients that you use in your baked
goods I would love to hear about them in
the comment line your cupcake tin with
just six liners make sure that you
scrape down the bowl and you'll know
your mixtures done when it kind of
resembles a chocolate mousse so it
should be light and fluffy and you can
see here it's really not running it's
quite scoopable
I'm gonna pop those six off into a
moderate oven and they only take about
15 minutes to bake but you'll know
they're done when they spring back in
the middle now it's on to our chopped
chili molten lava Center so take your
dark chocolate pour it into a bowl and
pour thickened cream or your whipping
cream over pop it in the microwave for
one minute intervals and stir it really
well in between it should only take
about two minutes three at the very most
and you need lots of stirring to make
sure it's got no lumps or bumps so
rather than just a powdered chili today
I'm going to use the red hot chili
pepper everything spread and I love this
because it adds an element of sweetness
to the ganache I will say depending on
the spice you like I recommend three
teaspoons for this size recipe if you
like your ganache a little bit spicier
don't try to add more of the chili
pepper paste because you're going to add
too much sweetness so adding just the
recommended amount and then use the
chili powder to adjust your spice once
you've stirred that through let it sit
for about 10 minutes for that chili to
really infuse and then you just want to
strain it through the strainer to get
rid of any lumps and bumps perfect
berries you can ask ready to go wait for
that to cool down a little bit it's not
going to set completely firm but you
don't want it to be too hot to touch
you're going to burn your hands cover it
with a bit of plastic wrap while that
one's cooling on the bench but
to make our frosting so just take some
of your butter and that should be
softened room-temperature or soft but
not melted pop it into the mixer you
want to add in your cherry essence and
I'm using a cherry essence here because
it's going to be a little bit more tart
than those maraschino cherries and it's
just going to add a little bit of tart
in amongst the sweetness of that ganache
and that chocolate cupcake kind of
balancing the flavors beat that butter
and essence for a full five minutes this
forms the base of a really nice light
fluffy frosting when your butters
thoroughly whipped you just want to add
in about a third of that powdered sugar
so the key to a really great buttercream
frosting is just adding that sugar a
third at a time and mixing it really
well between each addition
for about three minutes and repeat until
you've mixed in all of your powdered
sugar when it comes to frosting
consistency you'll always need to just
adjust it slightly with milk so I have
add about a tablespoon of milk to this
amount but it really depends on your
type of ingredients you're looking for
this nice smooth frosting that doesn't
fall off the spoon by itself and kind of
resembles ice cream to look at pop your
star piping tip into your piping bag and
fill that with your frosting and you can
pop that off to the side until our
cupcakes are ready to decorate you need
to make sure that those cupcakes are
completely cooled once they're ready to
frost you can take your love up filling
pop it into a ziplock bag we're going to
use that as a bit of a piping bag today
to fill my cupcakes I just took a little
circle cutter but you can use a cupcake
corer or even just a knife here and I
just called out a nice little Center
from the cupcake don't be tempted to
make this too large or else your
cupcakes are going to collapse on
themselves under the weight of that
frosting take one of your maraschino
cherries and make sure there's no stem
and plop it straight down into that
cupcake with a little bit of that syrup
if you can and then you just want to cut
a tiny little corner off your ziplock
bag and you're just going to flood the
center with that chopped chili ganache
this packs a pretty powerful punch so
you don't need too much of it but you do
want that satisfying spill effect that a
lava cake should have once they're full
just gently tap your cupcakes on the
bench to allow that ganache to settle
and then you want to take your frosting
bag so make sure you put a little bit of
that frosting squeezing out the end of
your piping nozzle and
need to start around the outside edge
otherwise you're going to spill that
ganache it's going to look messy so you
kind of want to curl your frosting
around the little puddle of ganache
before coming up in almost three
separate swirls to create that really
nice sundae style swirl you've
essentially trapped your little pond of
ganache inside so it's not going to make
a mess now this is gonna make a mess you
just want to quickly drizzle some
stripes of that ganache across the top
for a bit of color and a bit of texture
and then finish it off with one of those
maraschino cherries that's been drying
on that paper towel so you shouldn't get
any red cherry runoff here I love to
serve these ones with some little
spirals of that chopped chili ganache
just on the serving plate it gives you a
little bit more of a kick but it also
just looks really pretty and gives the
plate a little bit of detail I hope that
you guys have enjoyed today's mystery
box recipe brought to you by Mazetti and
my amazing Instagram followers thank you
all so much for your suggestions if you
want to purchase any of the ingredients
that we used in the mystery box today
make sure you check out Mazetti they've
got lots of holiday inspired fun recipe
ideas I think they've got giveaways
going all month and lots of delicious
goodies to buy as always guys thanks for
tuning in to my cupcake addiction
